paper_title.en: Wave forces acting on a semi-submerged porous circular cylinder

description.en: With potential applications in aquaculture as a sea cage or as floating breakwaters, a porous circular-cylinder semi-submerged in waves is investigated under the assumption of linear wave theory. To simplify the problem, the linear Darcy's law is applied to the porous boundary. The problem is solved by means of the eigenfunction expansion. The fluid domain is divided into two regions and different eigenfunctions are used. There are two horizontal porous plates in the inner region, i.e. the cover and bottom of the cylinder. This leads to a complicated 'dispersion' relation to determine the eigenvalues, the solutions of which are complex numbers. To solve the radiation problem, some particular solutions are sought to take account of the normal velocity of the body. The hydrodynamic forces are evaluated by integrating the pressure difference on the two sides of body surface. Computed examples are presented to observe the effects of porosity. The Haskind relations are examined for the porous body. It is found that the damping coefficient consists of two parts. In addition to the component of conventional wave-radiating damping, there exists a second component caused by the porous effects.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INSTITUTION OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERS PART M-JOURNAL OF ENGINEERING FOR THE MARITIME ENVIRONMENT

paper_title.en: Evolution of a Random Directional Wave and Freak Wave Occurrence

description.en: The evolution of a random directional wave in deep water was studied in a laboratory wave tank (50 m long, 10 m wide, 5 m deep) utilizing a directional wave generator. A number of experiments were conducted, changing the various spectral parameters (wave steepness 0.05<epsilon<0.11, with directional spreading up to 368 and frequency bandwidth 0.2<delta k/k<0.6). The wave evolution was studied by an array of wave wires distributed down the tank. As the spectral parameters were altered, the wave height statistics change. Without any wave directionality, the occurrence of waves exceeding twice the significant wave height (the freak wave) increases as the frequency bandwidth narrows and steepness increases, due to quasi-resonant wave-wave interaction. However, the probability of an extreme wave rapidly reduces as the directional bandwidth broadens. The effective Benjamin-Feir index (BFIeff) is introduced, extending the BFI (the relative magnitude of nonlinearity and dispersion) to incorporate the effect of directionality, and successfully parameterizes the observed occurrence of freak waves in the tank. Analysis of the high-resolution hindcast wave field of the northwest Pacific reveals that such a directionally confined wind sea with high extreme wave probability is rare and corresponds mostly to a swell-wind sea mixed condition. Therefore, extreme wave occurrence in the sea as a result of quasi-resonant wave-wave interaction is a rare event that occurs only when the wind sea directionality is extremely narrow.

paper_title.en: Wave drift forces affecting on maneuvering of a ship - theory and PMM test results
A nonlinear wave profile correction of the diffraction of a wave by a long breakwater: Fixed point approach
Nonlinear hydrodynamic forces on an accelerated body in waves

description.en: Wave-drift added mass results from nonlinear interactions between waves and low-frequency oscillatory motions of a floating body, in the presence of incident waves. In previous works, wave-drift damping which is the component of wave-drift force in phase with the velocity of low-frequency oscillations was investigated mainly based on a quasi-steady analysis. However, investigations related to wave-drift added mass, the component in phase with acceleration, were very few. In this paper wave-drift added mass is derived directly from a perturbation analysis with two small parameters and two time scales, using a Cartesian coordinate system that follows the low-frequency oscillations, dynamic oscillation model has been used. Especially, the method to solve higher-order potentials, which are necessary for evaluation of wave-drift added mass, is presented. Analytical solutions and calculated results of wave-drift added mass, and far field radiation conditions for each order of potentials are obtained. Also, wave-drift added mass of floating bodies has been systematically measured from a slowly forced oscillation test or a free decay test in waves. Experimental results are compared with calculated results. Then, for a supplement, the secular behavior that some velocity potentials show is discussed. Applying a multiple scale perturbation analysis to one of these problems, a nonsecular solution is obtained.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF OFFSHORE MECHANICS AND ARCTIC ENGINEERING-TRANSACTIONS OF THE ASME

paper_title.en: On the realization of nonlinear wave profiles using the Banach fixed-point theorem: Stokes wave in a finite depth

description.en: A new mathematical formulation for the realization of nonlinear wave profiles and its nonlinear solution procedure, based on the Banach fixed-point theorem, is proposed. To apply the formulation, a nonlinear equation for the Stokes wave in a finite depth was derived, and some numerical solutions are given. A numerical study showed that the proposed iteration method, based on linear progressive wave potential only, enabled us to realize the Stokes nonlinear wave profiles in a finite depth. The nonlinear strategy of iteration has a very fast convergence rate, i.e., only about 6-10 iterations are required to obtain a numerically converged solution.

paper_title.ja: Wave-drift added mass of a cylinder array free to respond to the incident waves（共著）
paper_title.en: Wave-drift added mass of a cylinder array free to respond to the incident waves

description.en: Conventional linear added mass and damping can be obtained when a floating body is forced to oscillate in the calm water. However, with the presence of the incident waves, there exists an alternative source of added mass and damping caused by the nonlinear interactions between waves and low-frequency oscillations. Proportional to the square of the wave amplitude, they are called the wave drift added mass and the wave drift damping. The problem of a circular cylinder array slowly oscillating in both diffraction and radiation wave fields is considered in the present work. The frequency of the low-frequency oscillation is assumed to be much smaller than the wave frequency. Perturbation expansion based on two time scales is performed to simplify the problem. Wave loads including the wave drift added mass are formulated by integration of the hydrodynamic pressure over the instantaneous wetted body surface.

research_project_title.ja: 海洋再生エネルギー利用の研究

description.ja: 海洋再生エネルギー利用について、適地、賦存量、効率、地域受容性等の全般を俯瞰的に研究し、日本における適合性を調べる。

research_project_title.ja: 戸田御浜再生プロジェクト

description.ja: 適切な大きさの領域である静岡県沼津市の戸田御浜を対象として、種数と個体数の両面から砂浜生態系の豊かさを取り戻すフィールド研究を行う。戸田御浜は、昭和30年代までは300種を越える貝類の生息する、世界でも有数の豊かな生態系の浜であったが、戸田大川の氾濫による泥の流入、砂流出を避けるための突堤堤防建設、潜堤・離岸堤の建設、山砂の投入などにより、貝類が激減した（H19年度調査では５種以下）と考えられている。このような砂浜生態系の劣化の原因を特定するために、砂浜の底質、底生生物を中心とした生態系、水質、流動場等の環境調査データを長期的に蓄積し、これらのデータを統合するとともに、生態系数値シミュレーションを実施し、戸田御浜再生法を提案する。また、これらの自然科学的調査に加え、生態系の回復具合や再生法について、防災、漁業、観光業等に携わる地域住民との合意形成を図りながら、10年後の戸田御浜再生を目指し、同様の各地の砂浜生態系回復の自然科学的・社会科学的方法論の確立を目指す。

research_project_title.ja: 沖合沈下生け簀と自動給餌システムの開発

description.ja: 耐波浪対策さえ可能になれば、外洋沖合生け簀は環境保全、早期育成、肉質改善等全ての面で優れている。そこで、外洋での沈下式生け簀と自動給餌システムの耐波浪安全性を水槽試験と理論計算から検討し設計法を確立する。

research_project_title.ja: Freak Waveの発生メカニズムと予報、回避法の研究

description.ja: Freak Waveの発生メカニズムを水槽試験とシムレーションにより研究しており、予報、回避法の提言を行う。
